class.name: PIXI.CanvasRenderer

parameters.name: [width=800]
parameters.help: the width of the canvas view

parameters.name: [height=600]
parameters.help: the height of the canvas view

parameters.name: [options.view]
parameters.help: the canvas to use as a view, optional

parameters.name: [options.transparent=false]
parameters.help: If the render view is transparent, default false

parameters.name: [options.resolution=1]
parameters.help: the resolution of the renderer retina would be 2

parameters.name: [options.clearBeforeRender=true]
parameters.help: This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.

class.help: The CanvasRenderer draws the Stage and all its content onto a 2d canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers that do not support webGL.\nDon't forget to add the CanvasRenderer.view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

public.name: render
public.help: Renders the Stage to this canvas view

parameters.name: stage
parameters.help: the Stage element to be rendered

public.name: resize
public.help: Resizes the canvas view to the specified width and height

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: the new width of the canvas view

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: the new height of the canvas view

private.name: mapBlendModes
private.help: Maps Pixi blend modes to canvas blend modes.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: the context 2d method of the canvas

public.name: CanvasMaskManager
public.help: Instance of a PIXI.CanvasMaskManager, handles masking when using the canvas renderer

public.name: clearBeforeRender
public.help:
This sets if the CanvasRenderer will clear the canvas or not before the new render pass.
If the Stage is NOT transparent Pixi will use a canvas sized fillRect operation every frame to set the canvas background color.
If the Stage is transparent Pixi will use clearRect to clear the canvas every frame.
Disable this by setting this to false. For example if your game has a canvas filling background image you often don't need this set.

public.name: context
public.help: The canvas 2d context that everything is drawn with

public.name: height
public.help: The height of the canvas view

public.name: renderSession
public.help: The render session is just a bunch of parameter used for rendering

public.name: transparent
public.help: Whether the render view is transparent

public.name: view
public.help: The canvas element that everything is drawn to.

public.name: width
public.help: The width of the canvas view
